reviews.review_msg: George makes theory meaningful. Course should be spread over 2 semesters. Great guy, knows exactly how deep the reading list is, but wants to give you a real milestone achievement - don't miss the final lecture for amazing cake and the Anointing of the Trowels with Real Dirt from Famous Sites!

This class was very boring, but George does a great job of making it bearable. I personally did not find the readings necessary, and without doing them I felt I was still able to do quite well. George is also very quick to answer emails and always available for extra help. Overall this class was not as hard as I thought it would be.

Really helpful, engaged in the topic, and tries to make the class as simple as possible (without sacrificing work load unfortunately). Very knowledgeable in the subject but demands a lot of work from students - wouldn't take it with a full or heavy course load. Also recommend taking it with friends so you can create a reading group.

George is by far the best prof I have ever had at SFU. Although his classes are hard, he always wants his students to succeed and will help you as much as he can to do so. He manages to keep classes interesting (even through the material may be boring) and is always available for extra help.

George is one of the best professors I've ever had at SFU. Archaeological Theory is the toughest class I've ever taken and George does not make it easy. However, his examples such as videos, lectures, and readings are extremely useful when trying to sort theory in your head. Arch 471 - tough course and there's no room to slack off!
Rough class, lots of readings but George is a super nice dude. I am glad everyone else seems to find him strangely hot, because I do too. PS, I'm a guy.
Good Guy, works hard, but loads of work

all in all i'm very fond of this proff. But he needs to listen to his students and take a critical eye to his theory course. It's really unreasonable.  BUT, he's a great lecturer, really helpful, if it weren't for the belief in student overload i'd give him the highest rating. And yes, i also occasionally find him strangely hot. Good guy too, cares

Great guy. Course blows and he thinks the work load is too small. The couse itself is useless largely irrelevant to any discipline and a waste of paper. Arch theory is not original at all and borrows far too much from real disciplines. Cancel Theory or refund students for taking the course.
Very intense course, would recommend cutting down the readings - as someone who's taken several theory courses you actually learn more this way. George is great though.

he's a good proff, he's a very nice man always willing to help a student. But i do take issue with the way arch 471 is set up.  The problem is that every article/book, etc has to be meticulously read/noted and there is just too much to retain in a short semester. The course need better supplements, not a true test of knowledge
professor is fine but course is extremely difficult.
I contemplated all the different ways I could hang myself from the rafters every time I had to sit through this man's class.

Fair dividing up of grades between exams/assignments. Super nice guy who is normal--rare ontop of this mountain. Easygoing and approachable, made a crusty, dry, excrutiating subject fascinating and pleasurable. Very available outside of class time, always answers his e-mail.
Explains things in a way that make it easier to understand. Interesting and relevant stories that aid in understanding. Very approachable.
Very nice and understanding. Makes theory more bearable than it really is :)
Tries really hard to make a boring subject interesting
